hof.net

Class UdpClientThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • hof.net.UdpClientThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class UdpClientThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    This Class is used to send AbstractMessages via an UDP-Network.
    It is designed as an Singleton and normally it runs until somebody closes the game.

    To use this class you have to call the prepareMessage-Method and then the Thread will automatically send the Message to the given InetAddress.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static UdpClientThread getInstance()
        This method is the only way to get an instance of this class. If there is no instance of this class or the Thread is already Terminated, a new instance will be created and the Thread started.
        Returns:
        the instance of this class.

      • run

        public void run()
        Main part of the Thread.
        The Thread sends Messages from the Queue, as long it is isActive.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean isActive)
        Sets if the thread is active or not. Then the Thread will be notified.
        Parameters:
        isActive - - active or inactive

      • prepareMessage

        public void prepareMessage(AbstractMessage message,
                  java.net.InetAddress inetaddress)
        Prepares a new Message to be send.
        The AbstractMessage gets serialized and is loaded into a DatagrammPacket. This packet gets added to the Queue.
        Parameters:
        message - the AbstractMessage to send
        inetaddress - the InetAddress to where the message will be send
